body_html:
@luoxiaoliaolan did u make it run? The documentation of this project is very limited. I am trying to train with my own dataset also. Actually, I picked one class (person) of the original classes of the pretrained model and trying to ignore the other classes. However, the label and prediction images resulted from here:

    total_summary = tf.summary.image('images', 
                                     tf.concat(axis=2, values=[images_summary, labels_summary, preds_summary]), 
                                     max_outputs=args.save_num_images)

are displayed as black. Then, when I try to inference, the result is incorrect. When I train the model using the original number of classes, 21, the result is ok. I read all the possible issues from the forum of the project but now, the forum is closed and I cannot get the info of how to make it work for less than 21 classes.

About your question, it happened to me when I left some images outside the folder.

body:
@luoxiaoliaolan  did u make it run? The documentation of this project is very limited. I am trying to train with my own dataset also. Actually, I picked one class (person) of the original classes of the pretrained model and trying to ignore the other classes. However, the label and prediction images resulted from here:
```
    total_summary = tf.summary.image('images', 
                                     tf.concat(axis=2, values=[images_summary, labels_summary, preds_summary]), 
                                     max_outputs=args.save_num_images)
```

are displayed as black. Then, when I try to inference, the result is incorrect. When I train the model using the original number of classes, 21, the result is ok. I read all the possible issues from the forum of the project but now, the forum is closed and I cannot get the info of how to make it work for less than 21 classes.

About your question, it happened to me when I left some images outside the folder.
